keyword: how many calories in 1 cup of flour
title: How Many Calories in 1 Cup of Flour?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in 1 cup of flour, plus carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown per serving for baking needs.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 Cup of Flour?
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted, standard US cup measure (â‰ˆ125 g).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type, brand, sifting, packing method, and moisture; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of all-purpose flour has about 455 calories and 95 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup of all-purpose flour?
What are the carbs in 1 cup of flour?
faqs.a: About 95 g of carbohydrates, mostly starch, with 3 g fiber.
Yes, around 13 g per cup, mainly gluten-forming proteins.

faqs.q: How much does 1 cup of flour weigh?
faqs.a: Typically 120-130 g for all-purpose flour; we used 125 g.

faqs.q: Calories in self-rising flour vs. all-purpose?
faqs.a: Similar base, but self-rising adds ~10-20 extra kcal per cup from leavening agents.
